statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Nevada 84, UNLV 78
article.story: RENO, Nev. (AP) -- Nick Fazekas scored 25 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to lead Nevada to an 84-78 win Saturday night over intrastate rival UNLV. Kevinn Pinkney added 18 points and Mo Charlo 13 for the Wolf Pack (4-1), who have won 18 straight at home dating to 2002. Romel Beck scored 17 points, Odartey Blankson 15 and Louis Amundson 13 for UNLV (2-2). Fazekas, who scored 17 points in the first half, made 8-of-14 from the field including two from 3-point range and 7-of-8 free throws. Tied 68-68, Fazekas passed inside to Jermaine Washington for a dunk, then slammed it home himself the next time down the floor for a 72-68 lead with 3:46 left. His 3-pointer from the top of the key made it 75-68 at 2:47. Beck answered with a 3-point goal to cut it to 76-72 with 2:09 but Nevada made all eight free-throw attempts in the final 1:47 to seal the victory. Pinkney scored the first six points of the game and Fazekas the next five, including a 3-pointer to open a 11-0 lead, which grew to 29-15 when Kyle Shiloh hit from 3-point range 7:42 before the half. UNLV answered with a 15-8 run capped by Joel Anthony's second slam dunk to cut the lead to 37-30 at 3:55, but Seth Taylor followed with a 17-footer, then hit a 3-point goal 2 seconds before the halftime buzzer to put Nevada ahead 49-37. UNLV opened the second half with a 16-6 run -- with six points each by Blankson and Amundson -- to pull to within 55-53 at 15:31. The Runnin' Rebels took their only lead 62-61 on Amundson's slam dunk with 8:22 left.
